title: Signed Ratio
content: The signed ratio captures how a point divides a line segment. If P divides AB such that P = (1-t)A + tB, then AP/PB = t/(1-t). Positive when P is between A and B, negative when outside.

title: Cevian Configuration
content: A structure capturing the configuration of three cevians through parameters d, e, f. Point D = (1-d)B + dC lies on BC, E = (1-e)C + eA lies on CA, and F = (1-f)A + fB lies on AB. The constraints ensure points are distinct from vertices.
mathContext: Parameters must satisfy d, e, f in (0, 1) excluding endpoints

title: Ceva Product
content: The product (AF/FB) * (BD/DC) * (CE/EA) of signed ratios. This equals signedRatio(f) * signedRatio(d) * signedRatio(e). The theorem states this equals 1 exactly when cevians are concurrent.

title: Parameter Condition
content: The algebraic condition d*e*f = (1-d)*(1-e)*(1-f) is equivalent to the Ceva product equaling 1. This symmetric form makes it easy to verify special cases.

title: Ceva's Theorem - Main Result
content: The central equivalence: cevaProduct cfg = 1 if and only if cevaParameterCondition cfg holds. The proof unfolds definitions, applies field_simp to clear denominators, then uses linarith for the algebraic manipulation.

title: Medians Satisfy Ceva
content: For the median configuration where d = e = f = 1/2, the Ceva product equals 1. This verifies that the three medians of a triangle are concurrent (meeting at the centroid).

title: Equal Parameters Characterization
content: For equal parameters d = e = f = t, the Ceva condition holds if and only if t = 1/2. This shows that medians are the unique configuration with equal division ratios that satisfies Ceva's theorem.
mathContext: t^3 = (1-t)^3 has unique real solution t = 1/2

title: Menelaus's Theorem (Dual)
content: Menelaus's theorem is the 'dual' of Ceva's theorem. While Ceva deals with concurrent lines (cevians meeting at a point), Menelaus deals with collinear points on a transversal. For collinearity, the product of signed ratios equals -1 instead of +1.
